movie_title: How learning to read changes lives ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Learning to read and write can change people's lives. Phil and Beth discuss this and teach you some

vocabulary.example: Over 700 million adults worldwide are illiterate.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to understand basic maths, count, and add up
vocabulary.example: The Friendship Project teaches reading, writing, and numeracy to Bangladeshi women and girls.

vocabulary.definition: your name written in your own handwriting style, showing that something has been written or agreed by you
vocabulary.example: Rashida used her fingerprint as a signature before learning to write her name.

vocabulary.definition: to trick or deceive someone in order to get their money or valuables
vocabulary.example: No one can cheat Rashida anymore now that she can read and keep track of her expenses.

vocabulary.definition: to assume that something is true without checking
vocabulary.example: Peter used to take reading for granted until he realized he needed help.
Peter thought he was thick because he struggled with reading, but now he's enjoying Harry Potter books.
